triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs serve as the core 'brain' enabling autonomous agents to understand and generate text.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: The paper proposes LLM-powered autonomous agents as patients, nurses, and doctors in the simulated hospital.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence in healthcare
triples.relevance: The paper applies AI to medical domain through simulation of healthcare processes and medical decision-making.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Doctor agents must plan treatment steps, utilizing automated planning capabilities for medical diagnosis and care.

triples.name: Reflection (artificial intelligence)
triples.relevance: The paper leverages reflection capabilities where agents reason about their decision-making in medical scenarios.

triples.name: Natural language generation
triples.relevance: LLMs use natural language generation to communicate diagnoses, treatments, and medical reasoning.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: The paper proposes intelligent agents that perceive medical environments and act autonomously to treat patients.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Doctor agents evolve and improve their performance through experience treating thousands of patient agents.

triples.name: Neuroevolution
triples.relevance: Doctor agents evolve over repeated interactions with patient agents without manual training data labeling.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Agent Hospital is a multi-agent system where patient, nurse, and doctor agents interact to simulate healthcare processes.
